intro: Bogenhardia nemoralis f. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy woodruff, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, fragrant white flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is characterized by its hairy leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Bogenhardia nemoralis f. hirsuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
